definition: glory, splendor, wealth and rank (idiom); high position and great wealth
Mt Hua 華山|华山 in Shaanxi/surname Hua

sentences.english: Do I why the absence for give up the reputation credit and riches of doing the regal concubine as a maidservant.
sentences.chinese: 我何必为一个婢女放弃做妃子的荣华富贵呢。

sentences.english: Well, Dingo didn't make me rich the day he walked into my home.
sentences.chinese: 狗来富，如果一条狗走进你家，你就会荣华富贵。

sentences.english: Because the villain thinks the nabobism, therefore obtains corruptly not tires.
sentences.chinese: 小人因为想荣华富贵，所以贪得到无厌。

sentences.english: The vermilion gates and windows better highlight the wealth and rank of her family.
sentences.chinese: 朱漆的门窗更能突显她家的荣华富贵。

sentences.english: By faith, Moses turned his back on prosperity.
sentences.chinese: 因著信心，摩西离弃了荣华富贵。

sentences.english: All the splendor 1 in the world is not worth a good friend .(Voltaire , French thinker)
sentences.chinese: 人世间所有的荣华富贵不如一个好朋友。

sentences.english: All the splendor in the world splendor in less than a good friend.
sentences.chinese: 人世间的一切荣华富贵不及一个好朋友。

sentences.english: It means that all the wealth in the world is nothing but a dream.
sentences.chinese: “南柯一梦”比喻世间荣华富贵不过是一场空梦。

sentences.english: All the splendor in the state is not worth a bad friend.
sentences.chinese: 人世间所有的荣华富贵不如一个好同学。

definition: high post and generous salary (idiom); promotion to a high official position
brocade garments, jade meals (idiom); a life of luxury/extravagance
lit. the divine steed Feihuang gallops (idiom)/fig. to achieve meteoric success in one's career
not having to worry about clothes and food (idiom)/to be provided with the basic necessities
to be promoted and gain wealth (idiom)
to live comfortably/happy and prosperous life
position and wealth (idiom); rank, fame and fortune
to rapidly go up in the world/meteoric rise (of a career, social position etc)
(of a deserving official) to grant his wife a title and make his son heir to his titles
